alert.note: Alert for Western Clay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 5:49PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Bradford and northwestern Clay Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 549 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Middleburg, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Middleburg, Kingsley, Oakleaf Plantation, Camp Blanding, Penney Farms, Lawtey and Asbury Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
